comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Son of Admiral Tōgō ... "Among the New York's passengers were Hyo Togo, twenty-two-year-old son of Admiral Togo. Young Togo has been studying agriculture in England and is enroute to his home. Despite the fact that he is son of Japan's naval hero, young Togo was the sickest man on board. He remained in his state room until etter weather was encountered two days ago. Captain Shiro Yamanouchi, of the Japanese navy...is accompanying young Togo to Japan."--"Liner New York Has Rough Voyage," Saratoga Springs Saratogian, 22 January 1916, p. 1: fultonhistory.com/Newspapers%2021/Saratoga%20Springs%20NY... A 1905 article that mentions Togo's son Hyo as a kid: cdnc.ucr.edu/cgi-bin/cdnc?a=d&d=SFC19051001.2.200.40 And another: trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/14717440?searchTerm=Togo

comment._content: pennylrichardsca: Thanks for the assortment of links about young Togo!  We will add a bit more information to the record.
